AIG to buy 35% stake in specialty insurer Convex for about $2.1 billion
data.description:
(Reuters) -Insurer AIG said on Thursday it will buy a 35% stake in privately held specialty insurer Convex Group for nearly $2.1 billion.

(Reporting by Arasu Kannagi Basil in Bengaluru; Editing by Vijay Kishore)

Kimberly-Clark Corporation Updates Earnings Guidance for the Year 2025
data.description:
Kimberly-Clark Corporation updated earnings guidance for the year 2025. As a reminder, the company adjusted its full-year outlook in August to be consistent with the reporting of the IFP business as discontinued operations. Its outlook for Net Sales, Organic Sales Growth and Adjusted Operating Profit growth now reflect the results of the remaining two segments, North America and IPC, as well as its overhead structure excluding the IFP business.

2025 Organic Sales Growth is expected to be broadly in line with the weighted average growth in the categories and countries it competes, which are currently growing at approximately two percent. Reported Net Sales are forecast to reflect a negative impact of approximately 100 basis points from currency translation, as well as a negative 290 basis point impact from a combination of the PPE divestiture and the exit of the company's private label diaper business in the US. The company expects its 2025 Adjusted Operating Profit to grow at a low single digit rate on a constant-currency basis versus the prior year.

Adjusted Earnings per Share Attributable to Kimberly-Clark are expected to grow at a low-to-mid single digit rate on a constant-currency basis including a negative 320 basis point impact from a combination of its PPE divestiture and the exit of the company's private label diaper business in the US, as well as a negative 100 basis point impact from items below operating profit including higher net interest expense, a higher adjusted effective tax rate, partially offset by lower shares outstanding.

Howmet Aerospace lifts annual forecast on strong demand for jets
data.description:
(Corrects higher end of profit forecast in paragraph 3 to $3.68 from $3.88)

(Reuters) -Howmet Aerospace on Thursday lifted its annual revenue and profit forecast as the maker of castings and fasteners expects demand to grow on the back of increased production of commercial jets at key customer Boeing.

The airplane parts maker forecasts annual revenue between $8.18 billion and $8.2 billion, compared to an earlier forecast of $8.08 to $8.18 billion.

It also raised its adjusted profit estimate to be between $3.66 per share and $3.68 per share, compared to $3.56-$3.64 previously.

(Reporting By Allison Lampert in Montreal and Nandan Mandayam in Bengaluru; Editing by Vijay Kishore)

Eli Lilly and Company Raises Earnings Guidance for the Year 2025
data.description:
Eli Lilly and Company raised earnings guidance for the year 2025. For the year, company increased full-year revenue guidance to be in the range of $63.0 billion to $63.5 billion, primarily driven by strong underlying business performance across the portfolio and foreign exchange rates. Based on these changes, EPS guidance has been increased to be in the range of $21.80 to $22.50 on a reported basis and $23.00 to $23.70 on a non-GAAP basis.

The company's updated 2025 financial guidance reflects adjustments shown in the reconciliation table below.

BYD profit declines for second straight quarter
data.description:
BEIJING (Reuters) -Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD posted a 32.6% fall in third-quarter profit from a year earlier, marking a second straight quarter of decline and the biggest fall in more than four years, as it faces increasing competition from domestic rivals.

Net profit totalled 7.8 billion yuan ($1.10 billion) while revenue dropped 3.1% year on year to 195 billion yuan, the first such decline in more than five years, according to a stock filing on Thursday.

($1 = 7.1230 Chinese yuan renminbi)

(Reporting by Qiaoyi Li, Zhang Yan and Brenda GohEditing by Tomasz Janowski)

data.title: Nissan says it now expects a smaller six-month operating loss
data.description:
TOKYO (Reuters) -Nissan Motor said on Thursday it expects to report a smaller first-half loss, helped by lower costs relating to emissions regulations and cost savings.

The Japanese automaker said it now expects an operating loss of 30 billion yen ($198.97 million) in the first half of the financial year through September, against a previous estimate of a 180-billion-yen loss.

($1 = 150.7800 yen)

(Reporting by David Dolan; Editing by Bernadette Baum)

data.title: Oji Holdings Corporation Revises Consolidated Earnings Guidance for the End of Second Quarter Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Oji Holdings Corporation revised consolidated earnings guidance for the end of second quarter ended September 30, 2025. For the period, the company expects net sales to be JPY 915,000 million, operating income to be JPY 16,700 million, profit attributable to owners of parent to be JPY 10,900 million and profit JPY 11.83 per share against net sales to be JPY 930,000 million, operating income to be JPY 21,000 million, profit attributable to owners of parent to be JPY 15,000 million and profit 16.04 per share. Reasons for Revision: For the second quarter of the year ending March 2026, while domestic business generally performed in line with financial forecasts, overseas business saw a decrease in profits due to a decline in market conditions for pulp and other products.

As a result, operating profit is expected to fall below the previous financial forecast. Furthermore, ordinary profit and profit attributable to owners of parent are also expected to fall below the previous financial forecast due to the decline in operating profit and other factors. The full-year consolidated financial forecast for the year ending March 2026 is currently under review.

It is scheduled to be announced simultaneously with the financial results for the second quarter of the year ending March 2026, which are scheduled for release on November 7, 2025.

Astellas Pharma Inc. Revises Consolidated Earnings Guidance for Fiscal Year 2025 Ending March 31, 2026
data.description: Astellas Pharma Inc. revised consolidated earnings guidance for fiscal year 2025 ending March 31, 2026. For the year, the company now expects revenue of JPY 2,030,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 1,930,000 million, Operating profit of JPY 240,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 160,000 million, Profit for the year of JPY 180,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 130,000 million, and Basic earnings per share of JPY 100.50 per share against previous guidance of JPY 72.61.

China Resources Microelectronics Limited Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
China Resources Microelectronics Limited reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 8,068.87 million compared to CNY 7,471.67 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 8,068.87 million compared to CNY 7,471.67 million a year ago.

Net income was CNY 525.5 million compared to CNY 499.31 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.3963 compared to CNY 0.3776 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.3962 compared to CNY 0.3776 a year ago.

Sichuan Hexie Shuangma Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Sichuan Hexie Shuangma Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 916.88 million compared to CNY 744.17 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 916.88 million compared to CNY 744.17 million a year ago.

Net income was CNY 293.55 million compared to CNY 244.56 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.39 compared to CNY 0.32 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.39 compared to CNY 0.32 a year ago.
